value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and on that stage, without any scenery, but richly dressed,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the old mummers were to act not Robin Hood, not <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-ever" key="Everyman">
            <choice>
              <sic>E  ry man</sic>
              <corr>Everyman</corr>
            </choice></rs>,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">not <rs>St Georges</rs> play but <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-faus" key="Doctor Faustus">Faust</rs>, <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-tamb" key="Tamburlaine">
            <choice>
              <sic>Tamberlaine</sic>
              <corr>Tamburlaine</corr>
            </choice></rs>, <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-haml" key="Hamlet">Hamlet</rs>, <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-lear" key="King Lear">Lear</rs>, </l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-ancl" key="Antony and Cleopatra">Antony and 
            <choice>
              <sic>Cleoptara</sic>
              <corr>Cleopatra</corr>
            </choice></rs>.</l>
